title.value: A Double-oracle, Logic-based Benders decomposition approach to solve the K-adaptability problem
title.justification: This is the exact title of the research paper as given.
title.quote: A Double-oracle, Logic-based Benders decomposition approach to solve the K-adaptability problem

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel double-oracle, logic-based Benders decomposition algorithm to solve K-adaptability problems with convex objective and constraints and integer first-stage decisions. The approach is numerically evaluated on adaptive shortest path, regular knapsack, and generic K-adaptability problems.

type.justification: The paper offers a new algorithm and provides numerical results obtained from experiments.
type.quote: Numerical results obtained from experiments on benchmark instances of the adaptive shortest path problem, the regular knapsack problem, and a generic K-adaptability problem demonstrate the performance advantage of the proposed approach when compared to state-of-the-art methods in the literature.

name.justification: The paper primarily deals with solving optimization problems under uncertainty.
name.quote: We propose a novel approach to solve K-adaptability problems with convex objective and constraints and integer first-stage decisions.

name.justification: The research tackles uncertainty in optimization problems using robust optimization techniques.
name.quote: Robust Optimization (RO) has become a classical framework for dealing with parameter uncertainty in optimization problems.

name.justification: The paper discusses adaptive robust optimization and K-adaptability in detail.
name.quote: An important class of RO problems that has gained considerable attention recently is adaptive/adjustable robust optimization (ARO).

name.justification: The problem involves combinatorial decision-making under uncertainty.
name.quote: The min-max-min robust combinatorial optimization problem that is solved via a double-oracle algorithm.
